intro: Cotylanthera loheri, commonly known as the Loher's cotylanthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
